snippet: Overseas travel for top school officials from around the nation, paid for by the nonprofit arm of a major educational publisher, draws the attention of an attorney general.
abstract: Michael Winerip On Education column notes mounting evidence that Pearson Foundation, nonprofit arm of national's largest educational publisher Pearson Education, engaged in improper lobbying while flying school superintendents abroad on lavish trips; office of New York State Attorney General Eric T Schniederman is looking into whether tax-exempt foundation, which is prohibited by state law from undisclosed lobbying, was used to benefit Pearson Education, profit-making company that publishes standardized tests, curriculums and textbooks.
